### Assessment

- **Viral Pharyngitis:** The patient presents with a sore throat, mild fever, and dry cough, along with difficulty swallowing and swollen glands in the neck. Physical examination reveals a temperature of 100.8°F and a red throat with swollen tonsils, consistent with viral pharyngitis (Line 14). The patient has also been in contact with a roommate who had a cold, supporting a viral etiology (Line 8).

line_references.text: I've been having a sore throat for the past three days.
Yes, I've had a mild fever and a dry cough.
Yes, it hurts a bit when I swallow, and I think my neck feels a bit swollen.
My roommate had a cold last week.
Your temperature is 100.8°F, and your throat looks red with some swelling of the tonsils.
